outerbrick@enchanter.desc[1]: A large brick in the wall seems loose.
outerbrick@enchanter.name: outerbrick
outerbrick@enchanter.desc[0]: The brick has been pushed through, revealing a tunnel leading west.

new_map@enchanter.name: new_map
new_map@enchanter.examine:
G
        / \
     A H   F
     |      \
     B---C   E
      \ / \
       D   P

Frobozz Magic Map Company (c)
new_map@enchanter.desc[0]: There's an old parchment map lying here.

door1@enchanter.name: door1
door1@enchanter.desc[0]: The door is open, allowing a glimpse of treasure beyond it.

cutlery@enchanter.desc[1]: There's a set of shiny silver cutlery on the table.
cutlery@enchanter.name: cutlery
cutlery@enchanter.examine: They look valuable.  It's a wonder Krill hasn't stolen them.
cutlery@enchanter.desc[0]: There's a set of shiny silver cutlery here.

candle@enchanter.name: candle
candle@enchanter.desc[0]: There's an inky black candle here.

chart@enchanter.name: chart
chart@enchanter.examine:
It shows you what you have to erase and draw on the map to trap the Presence
and get to Translucent Room P.

gate2@enchanter.name: gate2
gate2@enchanter.examine: It's an enormous castle gate.  It's held open forever by a magic spell.

spoon@enchanter.name: spoon
spoon@enchanter.examine: It's been worn down, and is rather sharp now.
spoon@enchanter.desc[0]: There's a bent, worn silver spoon here.

globe@enchanter.name: globe
globe@enchanter.examine:
It's a magic globe.  It shows the world as we know it, with a large red area
showing the lands that Krill has conquered.  You can see that the globe
keeps current with real time, for along parts of the edge of the red zone,
you can see minute flashes of light showing skirmishes that Krill is
winning.  You are alarmed to see that Krill's lands are within striking
distance of your home.

dungeon_map@enchanter.name: dungeon_map
dungeon_map@enchanter.examine:
G
        / \
     A H   F
     |      \
     B---C   E
      \ /
       D   P

Frobozz Magic Map Company (c)
dungeon_map@enchanter.desc[0]: There's an old parchment map lying here.

closedegg@enchanter.name: closedegg
closedegg@enchanter.examine:
It's the most beautiful treasure you've ever seen.  It's a mother-of-pearl
egg, with  a delicate gold clasp.  You  can't seem to open the clasp, it's
somehow connected to a  silver crank attached  to the egg.  There's also a
lapis-lazuli  lever, a ruby button, a polished agate  slide, and a diamond
switch on the egg.  You scratch  your head in confusion as  you ponder the
egg.

water@enchanter.name: water
water@enchanter.examine:
Upon closer examination, you see that the water is just an illusion.  Really,
there's nothing there.  Bummer.

gate1@enchanter.name: gate1
gate1@enchanter.examine: It's an enormous castle gate.  It seems to be magically closed and locked.

dungeonkey@enchanter.name: dungeonkey
dungeonkey@enchanter.examine: It was sat on by a bullfrog.  Ewww!
dungeonkey@enchanter.desc[0]: There's a rather slimy key here.

cup@enchanter.name: cup
cup@enchanter.examine: As you try to touch it, your hand passes through it!
cup@enchanter.desc[0]: A jewelled cup catches rays of sun and reflects them around the room.

cloth@enchanter.desc[1]: There's a beautiful silk tablecloth on one of the tables.
cloth@enchanter.name: cloth
cloth@enchanter.examine: It's a gorgeous red silk tablecloth.
cloth@enchanter.desc[0]: There's a beautiful silk tablecloth here.

kulcad_scroll@enchanter.desc[1]:
The turtle managed to drop the scroll in this room before getting squashed
by the hammer.  Poor, brave turtle...
kulcad_scroll@enchanter.name: kulcad_scroll
kulcad_scroll@enchanter.examine:
The scroll is titled 'Kulcad'.  In ancient Zorkian script, it reads: 'Undoes
powerful magic.  Use by saying: Kulcad'  You seem to remember hearing
somewhere that Zorkian spells can only be cast three times.

rezrov_scroll@enchanter.desc[1]:
The crone says, 'Well, you've finally come for help.  I've been waiting...
Here.  Take this.  And don't come back!'  She holds out a slightly crumpled
scroll, and beckons you to take it.
rezrov_scroll@enchanter.name: rezrov_scroll
rezrov_scroll@enchanter.examine:
The scroll is titled 'Rezrov'.  In ancient Zorkian script, it reads: 'Opens
magically locked items.  Use by saying: `rezrov <whatever>`'  You seem to
remember hearing somewhere that Zorkian spells can only be cast three times.
rezrov_scroll@enchanter.desc[0]: A slightly crumpled scroll has been dropped here.

bread@enchanter.desc[1]: There is a freshly baked loaf of bread inside the oven.
bread@enchanter.name: bread
bread@enchanter.examine: The smell of this fresh loaf of bread warms your heart.  Hope it's not poisoned.
bread@enchanter.desc[0]:
Somebody has dropped a nice loaf of bread here.  Better get it before the
animals do.

door6@enchanter.name: door6
door6@enchanter.examine: It's a solid steel cell door, with a barred window.

pencil@enchanter.desc[1]: Lying on the table beside the empty frame is a short stubby pencil.
pencil@enchanter.name: pencil
pencil@enchanter.examine: There's not much left of it.  It's from the Frobozz Magic Pencil Company.

sack@enchanter.desc[1]: There's a small, closed sack here.
sack@enchanter.name: sack

bedpost@enchanter.name: bedpost
bedpost@enchanter.examine: It looks like there might be something in it.
bedpost@enchanter.desc[0]: You see a hole in the bedpost.  You didn't see it until you dreamed about it.

openegg@enchanter.name: openegg
openegg@enchanter.examine:
The egg seems to have been opened by magic.  You gaze in wonder at the
colorful reflections in the egg's opening mechanisms.  The Gods will love
you for this one...
openegg@enchanter.desc[0]: There's an opened jewelled egg here just waiting to be picked up.

second_sign@enchanter.name: second_sign
second_sign@enchanter.examine: Maybe it's part of a series... this one reads, 'Burma'.

vaxum_scroll@enchanter.desc[1]: There's a scroll here, sweaty from the Statue's grip.
vaxum_scroll@enchanter.name: vaxum_scroll
vaxum_scroll@enchanter.examine:
The scroll is titled 'Vaxum'.  In ancient Zorkian script, it reads:
'Befriends somebody.  Use by saying: Vaxum <somebody>'  You seem to remember
hearing somewhere that Zorkian spells can only be cast three times.

turtle_food@enchanter.name: turtle_food
turtle_food@enchanter.examine: It looks disgusting... but it might actually taste good.
turtle_food@enchanter.desc[0]: There's a box of Frobozz Magic TurtleChow here.

scratches@enchanter.name: scratches
scratches@enchanter.examine: There are claw marks in the stone walls.

marker@enchanter.name: marker
marker@enchanter.examine:
It reads, 'This zone was shamelessly cloned from Infocom's game, Enchanter.  If
you enjoy this zone, please don't tell anybody about it.  Thanks.. -Jonix.'

deadturtle@enchanter.name: deadturtle
deadturtle@enchanter.desc[0]: There's a dead turtle here, his shell crushed by a giant hammer.

box@enchanter.name: box
box@enchanter.examine: As you try to touch it, your hand passes through it!
box@enchanter.desc[0]: There's a jewelled music box here.

dwarvensword@enchanter.name: DwarvenSword
dwarvensword@enchanter.examine:
The blade is wrought of the finest dwarven steel.  This is the Legendary
Sword of Zork.
dwarvensword@enchanter.desc[0]: The True Dwarven Sword of Zork is here.

bomb@enchanter.name: bomb
bomb@enchanter.desc[0]:
A massive crater can be seen where a mountain used to be as if that were all
destroyed by a massive bomb.  A god-made force field kept it contained here.
The road east has been blocked off with barricades.

gondar_scroll@enchanter.desc[1]: Partly hidden under some gravel is a stained scroll.
gondar_scroll@enchanter.name: gondar_scroll
gondar_scroll@enchanter.examine:
The scroll is titled 'Gondar'.  In ancient Zorkian script, it reads:
'Splashes somebody with water.  Use by saying: Gondar <somebody>'  You seem
to remember hearing somewhere that Zorkian spells can only be cast three
times.

gate4@enchanter.name: gate4
gate4@enchanter.desc[0]: The gate is held open forever by a spell.

innerbrick@enchanter.desc[1]: A large brick in the wall seems loose.
innerbrick@enchanter.name: innerbrick
innerbrick@enchanter.desc[0]: The brick has been pushed through, revealing a tunnel leading east.

bench@enchanter.name: bench
bench@enchanter.examine: The bench is strangely burned at one end.  It has been knocked over.

oven@enchanter.name: oven
oven@enchanter.examine:
This is an ancient, gas-powered oven.  The gas has long since been turned off,
though.  It's a bit rusty, but you still might be able to open it.

door3@enchanter.name: door3
door3@enchanter.examine: It's a plain oak door with a rather remarkable ornament on it.

guncho_scroll@enchanter.name: guncho_scroll
guncho_scroll@enchanter.examine:
The scroll is titled 'Guncho'.  In ancient Zorkian script, it reads:
'Banishes somebody forever.  Use by saying: Guncho <somebody>'  You seem
to remember hearing somewhere that Zorkian spells can only be cast three
times.
guncho_scroll@enchanter.desc[0]: There's a black scroll here, exuding incredible power.

pebbles@enchanter.name: pebbles
pebbles@enchanter.examine:
They used to be part of the castle... now they make a nice crunching sound as
you walk over them.

lantern@enchanter.desc[1]: Hidden behind the bench, you can see an old battered lantern.
lantern@enchanter.name: lantern
lantern@enchanter.desc[0]: There is a battered lantern here.

painting@enchanter.name: painting
painting@enchanter.examine: There's a soft glow coming from behind the painting.
painting@enchanter.desc[0]: The painting has been pushed aside, revealing a small niche.

niche@enchanter.name: niche
niche@enchanter.examine: It's a shallow niche, perfect for holding candles and charts.

first_sign@enchanter.name: first_sign
first_sign@enchanter.examine: It seems strangely familiar.  It reads simply, 'Use'.

door5@enchanter.name: door5
door5@enchanter.examine: It's a solid steel cell door, with a barred window.

enchanter40@enchanter.title: Going down...
enchanter40@enchanter.description:
You go down... and down... and down... and down... Are you getting
anywhere?

enchanter79@enchanter.title: Courtyard
enchanter79@enchanter.description:
You're in a barren, lifeless courtyard.  To the northeast is a large
temple.  You can hear a low chanting from the temple.

enchanter88@enchanter.title: Courtyard
enchanter88@enchanter.description:
You're in a barren, lifeless courtyard.  To the northwest is a large
temple.  You can hear a low chanting from the temple.

enchanter67@enchanter.title: Translucent Room 'P'
enchanter67@enchanter.description:
You're an a room with not-quite-opaque cream colored walls.  Behind the
walls you can see slow, fluid movement, as if the rock was alive.  The room
shows signs of an evil presence that was trapped here for millenia.  You can
still feel it's black residue brushing against your soul.  You can't wait to
get out of here.

enchanter65@enchanter.title: Translucent Room
enchanter65@enchanter.description:
You're an a room with not-quite-opaque cream colored walls.  Behind the
walls you can see slow, fluid movement, as if the rock was alive.

enchanter10@enchanter.title: The Foothills
enchanter10@enchanter.description:
You are at the edge of the forested foothills of Signal Mountain.  The trail
continues south.

enchanter78@enchanter.title: Courtyard
enchanter78@enchanter.description:
You're in a barren, lifeless courtyard.  To the southeast is a large
temple.  You can hear a low chanting from the temple.

enchanter83@enchanter.title: Courtyard
enchanter83@enchanter.description:
You're in a barren, lifeless courtyard.  To the south is a large temple.
You can hear a low chanting from the temple.

enchanter27@enchanter.title: Long Dull Hallway
enchanter27@enchanter.description: You are in a long dull hallway.  You can't help but yawn...

enchanter56@enchanter.title: Dungeon
enchanter56@enchanter.description:
This is the castle's dungeon.  The room is carved from stone.  In the
northeast corner of the room is a single cell door.  A staircase leads back
up into the castle, and in the southern wall is a pitch black tunnel.

enchanter42@enchanter.title: Kitchen
enchanter42@enchanter.description:
The castle's kitchen used to be a busy, noisy place.  It's quiet now...
but the room clearly has a story to tell.  Shortly after Krill came to this
land, he enslaved the people of the castle.  Some of them, he set to work at
dreary tasks, and others he simply tortured to death for the fun of it.  He
transformed the kitchen to a torture chamber, and clearly spent many hours
here watching the bodies twitch.  They aren't twitching now.  You turn your
head in disgust.

enchanter48@enchanter.title: Outside the Machine Room
enchanter48@enchanter.description:
You're at the top of the tower, standing in the doorway of a really noisy
room.  Giant axe blades are swinging back and forth across the room.  If you
were nimble enough, you could probably dodge them and get through, except
there are also enormous saw-blades spinning around the room.  And if this
weren't enough, a huge hammer crashes down on the floor every three or four
seconds.  It probably wouldn't be a good idea to go through there.  On the
other side of the mess, you can see some sort of control room.  You can
barely see a parchment scroll just inside the control room.  It must be
important!

enchanter90@enchanter.title: The Hidden Bar
enchanter90@enchanter.description:
Really, unless Krill's invited you here, you shouldn't be here.  The walls
are painted with blood, and various implements of torture hang from the walls.
No different from any other place here in the castle.  But of note in this room
is the bar.  At first glance, it seems to be a regular well stocked bar, with
everything from cinnamon schnapps to a bottle of tequila with the worm.  You
sit on a stool, and a ghostly bartender materializes before you (a la
Shining) to take your order.  Before you can mouth your wish, he nods, and
turns his back to you, and begins mixing the marguerita you wanted.  The
bartender turns around, and sets the glass on the bar before you.  You begin
conversing with him, sipping your marguerita, and reminiscing about the days
before Krill invaded the castle and murdered the local populace.  More
apparitions begin appearing around you, and you order another drink, and then
another.  Soon, you've forgotten who you are, and all you know is what these
simple villagers knew when Krill came and changed their world.  Before long,
you pass out, slumped over on the bar.
   When you wake up, you are alone, shivering, afraid, and determined to undo
the damage that Krill did here.

enchanter58@enchanter.title: Escape Tunnel
enchanter58@enchanter.description:
The inhabitant of the cell was trying to escape through here.  He had dug
six feet of tunnel from his cell with a spoon, and was trying to dig upwards
when he was caught.  He hadn't gotten far enough to escape.

enchanter86@enchanter.title: Courtyard
enchanter86@enchanter.description:
You're in a barren, lifeless courtyard.  To the southwest is a large
temple.  You can hear a low chanting from the temple.

enchanter5@enchanter.title: Outside the Shack
enchanter5@enchanter.description:
You are standing outside a small shack.  The road continues to the
northeast, or you can enter the shack to the northwest.

enchanter16@enchanter.title: Inside the Village
enchanter16@enchanter.description:
There is an eerie silence here.  All of the houses are deserted, and several
have actually burned down.  One small hovel to the south, however, has smoke
rising from the chimney.  The road here turns to the northwest.

enchanter17@enchanter.title: Small Hovel
enchanter17@enchanter.description:
You look around in wonder at the inside of the hovel.  Shelves of strange
and wonderful potions line the walls.  There is a bench in the middle of the
room, covered with smoking vials of all types.  An ancient crone stands behind
the bench, stirring a boiling pot.  She hears you enter, and looks up.

enchanter21@enchanter.title: Inside the Castle Gates
enchanter21@enchanter.description:
Well, you're inside the castle.  Maybe you shouldn't be here.  The guards
certainly think so...

enchanter63@enchanter.title: Translucent Room
enchanter63@enchanter.description:
You're an a room with not-quite-opaque cream colored walls.  Behind the
walls you can see slow, fluid movement, as if the rock was alive.

enchanter38@enchanter.title: Tower Landing
enchanter38@enchanter.description:
You can go up, or down.  It looks awfully far...
   Or you can go back west.  It's up to you.

enchanter44@enchanter.title: Green Meadow
enchanter44@enchanter.description:
You momentarily forget about the horror of the castle as you look around
in awe.  The meadow is green, birds are singing, rabbits are hopping through
the grass, and all is peaceful.  You feel like taking off your shoes and
running around barefoot, but you'd probably stub your toe on a hidden rock.
There's a path leading southwest, and the castle rises to the north.

enchanter33@enchanter.title: Dense Swamp
enchanter33@enchanter.description: The swamp is teeming with life... and most of it wants to kill you.

enchanter3@enchanter.title: Long and Winding Road
enchanter3@enchanter.description:
This is a long, winding road.  Far off to the east, you can see Signal
Mountain.  There is a &+Csign&* here, by the road.

enchanter70@enchanter.title: Atop the Tower
enchanter70@enchanter.description:
You're at the top of the southwestern tower.  There's a solid oak door
here.

enchanter34@enchanter.title: Guarded Door
enchanter34@enchanter.description:
Other than the large oak door at the north end of the room, this room is
bare.  But what a door it is -- On the center of it is some sort of ornament.
It looks like a wild boar's head.. with snakes for hair, and razor-sharp knives
for teeth.  It seems to be slobbering acid.

enchanter39@enchanter.title: Climbing up...
enchanter39@enchanter.description: You go up... and up... and up... and up... Are you getting anywhere?

enchanter85@enchanter.title: Courtyard
enchanter85@enchanter.description:
You're in a barren, lifeless courtyard.  To the north is a large temple.
You can hear a low chanting from the temple.

enchanter54@enchanter.title: Gallery
enchanter54@enchanter.description:
You yawn in boredom as you walk through this art gallery.  As art goes,
this is definitely nothing to write home about.  Almost all of the paintings
are still-life fruit bowls.  One, however, catches your eye... it's a
painting of the castle as it was before Krill took it over.  It's hard to
believe the castle was once beautiful.  You notice that in the &+Cpainting&*,
there are only four towers.  It seems that Krill added his fifth tower
himself.  You shiver in fear as you think about that inky black tower.  The
painting seems to be glowing faintly.

enchanter23@enchanter.title: Pebbled Pathway
enchanter23@enchanter.description:
The walls and roof of the corridor here have crumbled to dust long ago.
The floor of this hallway is littered with &+Cpebbles&*.  You can re-enter the
castle to the north, where you can see the base of the northwestern tower.

enchanter66@enchanter.title: Translucent Room
enchanter66@enchanter.description:
You're an a room with not-quite-opaque cream colored walls.  Behind the
walls you can see slow, fluid movement, as if the rock was alive.

enchanter28@enchanter.title: First Hall of Mirrors
enchanter28@enchanter.description:
This is a long, mirrored hall.  You do a doubletake as you realize the
mirrors aren't reflecting the hall... they seem to show some sort of maze of
twisting passages, all alike.

enchanter73@enchanter.title: Tower Landing
enchanter73@enchanter.description:
The stairs go up a long way, and down a long way.  But there's a tunnel
leading east that you didn't see before.  Dark smoke billows out of the
tunnel and rises up the tower.

enchanter4@enchanter.title: Fork in the Road
enchanter4@enchanter.description:
The road forks here.  You can go southeast, or take the more well-travelled
path to the northeast.  Signal Mountain looms before you.

enchanter72@enchanter.title: Featureless Hallway
enchanter72@enchanter.description: You're in a long north-south hallway.

enchanter24@enchanter.title: Northwestern Tower
enchanter24@enchanter.description:
You are at the base of a short, squat tower.  The hallway turns to the west
here, and there is a short flight of stairs leading up the tower.

enchanter51@enchanter.title: Outside the Machine Room
enchanter51@enchanter.description:
You're at the top of the tower, standing in the doorway of a really noisy
room.  Giant axe blades are swinging back and forth across the room.  If you
were nimble enough, you could probably dodge them and get through, except
there are also enormous saw-blades spinning around the room.  And if this
weren't enough, a huge hammer crashes down on the floor every three or four
seconds.  It probably wouldn't be a good idea to go through there.  On the
other side of the mess, you can see some sort of control room.  Just inside
the machine room, you can see a squashed giant turtle.  The walls have lots
of &+Cscratches&* on them.

enchanter64@enchanter.title: Translucent Room
enchanter64@enchanter.description:
You're an a room with not-quite-opaque cream colored walls.  Behind the
walls you can see slow, fluid movement, as if the rock was alive.

enchanter74@enchanter.title: Climbing up...
enchanter74@enchanter.description:
You go up... and up... and up... and up... Are you getting anywhere?
Dark inky smoke rises from below you.

enchanter47@enchanter.title: Base of the Tower
enchanter47@enchanter.description:
You're at the base of another tower.  You can hear the sound of heavy
machinery above you.

enchanter82@enchanter.title: Courtyard
enchanter82@enchanter.description:
You're in a barren, lifeless courtyard.  To the northeast is a large
temple.  You can hear a low chanting from the temple.  You can re-enter the
castle to the south.

enchanter6@enchanter.title: Inside the Shack
enchanter6@enchanter.description:
You are inside the small shack.  Broken &+Cbenches&*, chairs, and tables are
strewn about the room.  There is a broken &+Coven&* in the corner.

enchanter31@enchanter.title: North Gate
enchanter31@enchanter.description:
You are at the northern gate of the castle.  Looking through the gate, you
can see a dense swamp.  There is a tower to the east, and the corridor turns
back toward the south here.

enchanter22@enchanter.title: Junction
enchanter22@enchanter.description:
The corridor splits up here, going north and south to towers, or continuing
east into a large courtyard.  You hear the sound of chanting from the
courtyard.

enchanter50@enchanter.title: The Control Room
enchanter50@enchanter.description:
You must be immortal to have made it this far...  But actually, this
control room has no controls in it.  All the dials and levers and switches
you see here are illusions, meant to fool the poor mortals on the other side
of the machine room.  Hee hee...

enchanter41@enchanter.title: Mess Hall
enchanter41@enchanter.description:
The smell of rotting meat here makes you want to throw up.  This used to
be the castle's banquet hall.  Now, only the dogs feast here...

enchanter43@enchanter.title: Southern Gates
enchanter43@enchanter.description:
The gates here seem shiny and new, in stark contrast to the rest of the
castle.  They're wide open, and through them you can see a wide green
meadow, and beyond it, the sea.  There's a tower to the east, and the hall
continues to the west or the north.  You can hear the sound of heavy
machinery to the east.

enchanter36@enchanter.title: Library
enchanter36@enchanter.description:
The bookshelves here are empty, and from the amount of dust on them, you
can see they've been empty for centuries.  Has Krill reallly been around
that long?
   You can hear low chanting sounds from the south.

enchanter26@enchanter.title: Treasure Room
enchanter26@enchanter.description:
The light streaming through the open window casts a million reflections in
here.  You gaze in awe at the mountains of treasure in here.  Greedily, you
take a step forward.

enchanter53@enchanter.title: Banquet Hall
enchanter53@enchanter.description:
This is where the inhabitants and guests of the castle used to gather to
dine.  The tables are still here, and some are even decked in resplendent
scarlett tablecloths.  Apparently something kept Krill away from here.

enchanter2@enchanter.title: Long and Winding Road
enchanter2@enchanter.description:
This is a long, winding road.  Far off to the east, you can see Signal
Mountain.  There is a &+Csign&* here, by the road.

enchanter15@enchanter.title: Village Outskirts
enchanter15@enchanter.description:
You are outside the village.  Most of the houses seem to be deserted, but
you can see smoke rising from one chimney.  Signal Mountain rises majestically
to the north.

enchanter55@enchanter.title: Top of the Stairs
enchanter55@enchanter.description:
You're at a featureless part of the hallway.  There's a walk-in closet to
the north, and south of you is a staircase leading down into the dungeon.
There's a dark room to the east, and a tower to the west.

enchanter69@enchanter.title: Southwestern Tower
enchanter69@enchanter.description:
You're at the base of the southwestern tower.  A staircase leads up, and
hallways go off to the north or east.

enchanter1@enchanter.title: Long and Winding Road
enchanter1@enchanter.description:
This is a long, winding road.  Far off to the east, you can see Signal
Mountain.  There is a &+Csign&* here, by the road.

enchanter29@enchanter.title: Second Hall of Mirrors
enchanter29@enchanter.description:
This is a long, mirrored hall.  You do a doubletake as you realize the
mirrors aren't reflecting the hall... they seem to show some sort of maze of
twisting passages, all alike.

enchanter81@enchanter.title: Courtyard
enchanter81@enchanter.description:
You're in a barren, lifeless courtyard.  To the east is the front door of
a large temple.  You can hear a low chanting from the temple.

enchanter46@enchanter.title: Warm Beach
enchanter46@enchanter.description:
Waves crash on the shore here.  The water's incredibly warm, and you want
to stay forever.  The sun is shining down on you, and you can feel your skin
tanning already.  It's a beautiful day for a picnic.

enchanter37@enchanter.title: Main Junction
enchanter37@enchanter.description:
You've come to another junction in the hall.  East of here, you can see a
landing and a dark staircase going both up and down.  You presume it's the
fifth, dark, smoky tower.  To the west is a large courtyard, with some sort
of temple in it.  The chanting sound seems to be coming from there.  The
hall continues to the south.

enchanter87@enchanter.title: Courtyard
enchanter87@enchanter.description:
You're in a barren, lifeless courtyard.  To the west is a large temple.
You can hear a low chanting from the temple.  You can re-enter the castle to
the east.

enchanter13@enchanter.title: Still on the Road
enchanter13@enchanter.description: The road continues on to the southeast, and back to the northwest.

enchanter8@enchanter.title: Overgrown Trail
enchanter8@enchanter.description:
The trail turns northwest here.  It's almost impossible to hack your way
through the bushes here.

enchanter20@enchanter.title: At the Castle Gates
enchanter20@enchanter.description:
Everything around here is dead.  The castle gates loom before you.  The evil
inside the castle is so strong, you can feel it.  You can still turn back...
Maybe you should...

enchanter19@enchanter.title: Before the Castle
enchanter19@enchanter.description:
The vegetation is beginning to thin here, as you approach the castle.  You
can still turn back... Maybe you should...

enchanter7@enchanter.title: Bend in the Road
enchanter7@enchanter.description:
The road bends towards the southeast here.  Small trails lead northeast into
the woods, and south up the mountain.

enchanter75@enchanter.title: Going down...
enchanter75@enchanter.description:
You go down... and down... and down... and down... Are you getting
anywhere?

enchanter9@enchanter.title: End of the Trail
enchanter9@enchanter.description:
The trail emerges into a small clearing.  A stream of sparkling clear &+Cwater&*
runs by.  There is a stone &+Cmarker&* here.

enchanter45@enchanter.title: Edge of the Beach
enchanter45@enchanter.description:
The path led you to a sandy beach on the Flathead ocean.  The sea is
southwest, and the meadow lies back to the northeast.

enchanter35@enchanter.title: Map Room
enchanter35@enchanter.description:
This room was once a library, but Krill's ransacked it.  Now, there's
nothing left here but a large &+Cglobe&* and a table.  There's a frame on the
table that once held a map, but the map is missing.

enchanter59@enchanter.title: Translucent Room
enchanter59@enchanter.description:
You're an a room with not-quite-opaque cream colored walls.  Behind the
walls you can see slow, fluid movement, as if the rock was alive.

enchanter30@enchanter.title: Third Hall of Mirrors
enchanter30@enchanter.description:
This is a long, mirrored hall.  You do a doubletake as you realize the
mirrors aren't reflecting the hall... they seem to show some sort of maze of
twisting passages, all alike.

enchanter60@enchanter.title: Translucent Room
enchanter60@enchanter.description:
You're an a room with not-quite-opaque cream colored walls.  Behind the
walls you can see slow, fluid movement, as if the rock was alive.

enchanter76@enchanter.title: Krill's Laboratory
enchanter76@enchanter.description:
You've stumbled into Krill's lab.  He looks up at you, with a shocked
expression on his face.  As you advance towards him, he begins mumbling the
words to some ancient, terrible spell.

enchanter77@enchanter.title: Courtyard
enchanter77@enchanter.description:
You're in a barren, lifeless courtyard.  To the east is a large temple.
You can hear a low chanting from the temple.  You can re-enter the castle to
the west.

enchanter52@enchanter.title: Empty Hallway
enchanter52@enchanter.description:
That's just it... it's an empty hallway.  You hear the crashing of a
giant hammer somewhere to the east.

enchanter25@enchanter.title: Atop the Tower
enchanter25@enchanter.description: You're at the top of the tower.  There is a wooden door to the north.

enchanter18@enchanter.title: Hairpin Turn
enchanter18@enchanter.description:
The road has turned sharply here.  The fork in the road is northwest, or
you can go to the village, southwest of here.

enchanter80@enchanter.title: Courtyard
enchanter80@enchanter.description:
You're in a barren, lifeless courtyard.  To the southeast is a large
temple.  You can hear a low chanting from the temple.

enchanter84@enchanter.title: Temple of Krill
enchanter84@enchanter.description:
You've wandered into the Temple of Krill.  All of Krill's loyal followers
are gathered here.  The floor is sticky with sacrificed blood here.  None of
the little hairy men have taken any notice of you... they're all
concentrating on the giant altar in the center of the room.  At the top,
there's a statue of Krill.

enchanter49@enchanter.title: The Machine Room
enchanter49@enchanter.description:
You run into the room, and dodge the first few axe blades.  Then, a saw
blade flies at your neck, and you don't duck fast enough to avoid
decapitation.  Your head rolls a few feet away from your body, then the
hammer squashes it.

enchanter32@enchanter.title: Edge of the Swamp
enchanter32@enchanter.description:
Tall trees surround you as you leave the castle.  A muddy path leads west
into a murky swamp.

enchanter71@enchanter.title: Bedroom
enchanter71@enchanter.description: You're in a large bedroom with a four-poster feather bed here.

enchanter61@enchanter.title: Translucent Room
enchanter61@enchanter.description:
You're an a room with not-quite-opaque cream colored walls.  Behind the
walls you can see slow, fluid movement, as if the rock was alive.

enchanter62@enchanter.title: Translucent Room
enchanter62@enchanter.description:
You're an a room with not-quite-opaque cream colored walls.  Behind the
walls you can see slow, fluid movement, as if the rock was alive.

enchanter14@enchanter.title: Another Fork in the Road
enchanter14@enchanter.description:
You can keep going around the mountain to the southwest, or go east towards
the dark castle.  A quaint, Tyrolean village lies off to the southwest.

enchanter12@enchanter.title: Signal Mountain
enchanter12@enchanter.description:
Finally, you collapse in exhaustion at the peak of Signal Mountain, or
Lonely Mountain as it is also called.  The air is chilly, but amazingly fresh
up here.  You look around in awe... Far off to the west, you can barely make
out the Temple of Paradise, and a small village.  But your heart freezes in
fear as you look to the east.  Rising out of the forest is a black castle, with
five towers.  One of the towers is larger than the others, and inky black smoke
rises from the top.  From here, you can see that the road you were on encircles
the mountain.  There is a small village to the south.

enchanter11@enchanter.title: Halfway to the Top of Signal Mountain
enchanter11@enchanter.description:
The footing is treacherous here, but the view is worth it.  Just wait till
you get to the top.

enchanter57@enchanter.title: Dungeon Cell
enchanter57@enchanter.description:
This is the only cell in the castle's dungeon.  In one corner there is a
deep hole, with an evil smell coming from it.  The cell door is south.

enchanter89@enchanter.title: The Altar of Krill
enchanter89@enchanter.description:
You're at the top of Krill's altar.  The sound of Krill's followers'
gutteral chants curdle your blood.

goat@enchanter.name: Goat
goat@enchanter.examine: You're invading his territory, and he doesn't like that.
goat@enchanter.description: A mountain goat is here, defending his territory.

krill@enchanter.name: Krill
krill@enchanter.examine:
He's cast a spell of immortality on himself.  There's only one way to defeat
him.
krill@enchanter.description: The evil Enchanter Krill stands before you, weaving a spell of destruction.

turtle@enchanter.name: turtle
turtle@enchanter.description: A large turtle is sunning himself on the beach here.

fly@enchanter.name: Fly
fly@enchanter.examine: Must be some kind of wasp...
fly@enchanter.description: A big yellow fly with a lethal looking stinger dive-bombs you.

dido@enchanter.name: Dido
dido@enchanter.examine: He's looking greedily at your eyes.
dido@enchanter.description: Dido the faithful watchdog is here, looking for an eye to claw out.

guardian@enchanter.name: Guardian
guardian@enchanter.examine:
Chills run down your spine as you look at the Guardian.  It's looking back at
you, and it seems as though it can see right into your soul.
guardian@enchanter.description: A being made of pure evil is guarding the treasure.

presence@enchanter.name: Presence
presence@enchanter.examine: You can barely see it, but you can certainly feel it's evil presence.
presence@enchanter.description: You see a wavering form in the air before you... it's about to strike!

dog@enchanter.name: dog
dog@enchanter.examine: He looks like he hasn't eaten in weeks.  But he's been sharpening his teeth...
dog@enchanter.description: A mangy dog jumps at your throat!

fido@enchanter.name: Fido
fido@enchanter.examine: He really looks hungry... he thinks you'll do nicely.
fido@enchanter.description: Fido the faithful watchdog is here, looking for scraps.

mutie@enchanter.name: Mutie
mutie@enchanter.examine: It used to be human, but it's skin is green, slimy, and bubbly.
mutie@enchanter.description: There's a really ugly mutant here.

ogre3@enchanter.name: ogre3
ogre3@enchanter.examine: You really shouldn't be examining these ogres... they're going to kill you.
ogre3@enchanter.description: Yubba the Ogre is going to have you for breakfast.

bullfrog@enchanter.name: Bullfrog
bullfrog@enchanter.examine:
You can't get at the key unless the frog's out of the way... and he doesn't
want to get out of the way.
bullfrog@enchanter.description: A rather large bullfrog is sitting on a key!

statue@enchanter.name: Statue
statue@enchanter.examine:
The statue looks fearsome... you hope the artist exaggerated Krill's
features.
statue@enchanter.description: The statue of Krill stands here.

ogre1@enchanter.name: ogre1
ogre1@enchanter.examine: Jubba's your standard big, mean, ugly ogre.
ogre1@enchanter.description: Jubba the Ogre can't wait to bash your head in.

ogre2@enchanter.name: ogre2
ogre2@enchanter.examine: Hubba's a bit overweight... probably from eating too many mortals.
ogre2@enchanter.description: Hubba the Ogre advances menacingly towards you.

dragon@enchanter.name: Dragon
dragon@enchanter.examine: Krill's creations cannot be defeated by ordinary weapons.  Maybe magic...
dragon@enchanter.description: Krill's pet dragon is standing between you and Krill, ready to toast you.

basilisk@enchanter.name: Basilisk
basilisk@enchanter.examine: Krill's creations cannot be defeated by ordinary weapons.  Maybe magic...
basilisk@enchanter.description:
Krill finishes his spell, and a very unfriendly basilisk appears hissing
before you.

frog@enchanter.name: Frog
frog@enchanter.examine:
Those claws look like they can take out an eye...  That's probably what they're
for.
frog@enchanter.description: Funny, there's a frog here with claws.

ornament@enchanter.name: Ornament
ornament@enchanter.examine: As you move closer to the ornament, it comes to life and hisses loudly at you!
ornament@enchanter.description: Looks like you're going to have to kill the ornament... it's alive.
